title: Hanging, "Tree of Life", 1919–26
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: wax resist dyed (batik), warp-faced plain weave
markings: Artist's monogram in lower right: LBB
description:
Vertical rectangular silk mural. The theme Earth, Air, Fire and Water symbolized by a flowering tree soaring up into the sky from a base of erupting volcanos. The lower border is made up of waves which become a curving floral line at the sides and top. Clouds hover above the volcanos. Birds circle the tree at the bottom which at top become stars and planets. Background  is blue, the tree is white, the volcanos are deep blue with orange lava flows, flowers are red, orange and yellow with dark blue details.
Lined with natural cotton plain weave.

tombstone.epitaph:
Hanging, "Tree of Life", 1919–26.
1919–26. Medium: silk
Technique: wax resist dyed (batik), warp-faced plain weave. Gift of Lydia Bush-Brown. 1974-23-7.
